\begin{abstract}
Nonleptonic decays $\overline{B} \rightarrow D \pi^-$ or
$\overline{B} \rightarrow D^* \pi^-$ are dominated by factorizable
contributions. In the heavy quark limit, nonfactorizable contribution
arises from strong radiative correction and power corrections in
$1/m_b$. I calculate the decay rates for $\overline{B
author: Junegone Chay
